title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Very brief and informative interview interview. Look your best you can. You will get email from them fir your interview as you can. I don’t know how to write more than 30 words.
Interview Questions: What experiences do you have related to the role?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions: Mostly asked about research experience and how and if you can contribute to the lab publications. You are also required to have experience mentoring students, both undergrad and grad. Expected to be able to contribute research and data to participate in International conferences.
Interview Questions: How can you improve the research environment?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applied for Project Associate. Lasted 12 minutes. Simple questions like “why do you want to work here?”, “tell me about yourself?”. Two people interviewed me but really only one asked the questions. I got an offer the next day.
Interview Questions: Please tell us about yourself?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions: It was an easy interview process. I recommend you to be prepared and you should be fine. Read the work description and align what you will say with that.  Practice, practice, practice!
Interview Questions: 3 weaknesses and 3 strenghts

title: Accountant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions: Filled out application, never got a call back. Job application requires 3 references, and resume.  Submitted the application, waited for a call, but got an email that I was not selected.
Interview Questions: Was not selected for an interview.

title: IT Service Desk Agent Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty simple and straight forward. They will ask about your technical computer skills and knowledge to make sure you are comfortable using them on a daily basis. Additionally, the way you present yourself, speak, and your answers regarding customer service is also a major factor. The job will need you to interact with many people on a daily basis, so they need you to be ready for that. Besides that, as long as you're comfortable and confident, and know your way around computers you should be good.
Interview Questions: If you witness a fellow employee become irritated and argue with a customer, what should you do?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions: Good ver nice anf polite and helpful for you and the other person that you can use for your order work with a handful of questions about your experience with the other activities
Interview Questions: How was your previous job

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions: It is nice interview. Used ZOOM. Because COVID. Maybe now person to person. But Do not have pressure about job. Graduate Office is so nice. Sometime They gave Scholarship. If do you try first semester. Let's try Dean's scholarship.
Interview Questions: What was your explains at undergrad.

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions: The process was lengthy but because of the HR Department. The advising team seem to hire people who don’t care about students and their academic achievements, overall, terrible place. Grateful I withdrew my application.
Interview Questions: What their stupid motto meant

title: Web Content Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was a video call with 3 members of the department alternating your basic interview questions. 
These ranged from "Tell me about a time.." to asking about specific skills related to the position.
Interview Questions:
How do you deal with pressure or stressful situations?
Do you prefer working independently or on a team?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions:
Volunteered with them and when they needed someone to take over, I was the first person they reached out to. My interview was a phone call? Are you interested. 
It pays to help, volunteer and have people before you need them.  However, I still struggle with keeping up.
Interview Questions: He wanted to know my philosophy on teaching. ...Legacy!

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Once I was selected for an interview, I was asked to create a power point presentation for the School of medicine for admissions and financial aid. The power point had to be seven minutes long and I had to be prepared to present at the time of my interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little bit about yourself.

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions: Had a call then in person interview. Pretty standard. They also had a sheet of coding questions which were mostly SQL questions. I think I missed most of those but answered the C# questions correctly. Regardless I was given the job and learned on the job.
Interview Questions: What was your last job like.

title: Clinical Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions: Meet with selection committee of the department, answer questions one on one in a meeting room setting, have personal interviews with department head and other leaders of the department, as well as the college dean.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to teach with us? What is your vision? What strengths do you bring to our program and our university?

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions: Simple, passionate, right to the point, these people interviewed with all the points needed in their search of hiring. Overall the process was easy and a fun time. UTRGV does a good job interviewing.
Interview Questions: One thing they asked was about my favourite work.

title: Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview, with 4 different doctors. They all had different behavioral or situational questions. A couple of cultural questions and questions relating to psychotherapy. The residents there seemed happy with their program though they didn’t seem to like how limited it was.
Interview Questions: How do you control for counter transfers

title: Language Institute Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions:
It was a pretty easy interview, pretty much asking the basic questions such as, tell us about yourself, your aspirations, also strengths and weaknesses.
You should dress appropriate to the occasion.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about yourself
What is a weakness you have

title: Special Needs Grammar Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions: Brief and to the point. The head instructor introduced themself and then took me to their office where they interviewed me. They asked a couple of questions and I received an offer the next day.
Interview Questions:
1) Are you a current student? 
2)What is your GPA?
3) Are you the recipient of a Pell grant?
4) How good are your writing skills.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions: the process was pretty smooth, everyone was polite and overall a good experience. the questions asked were straight to the point and i got to ask questions as well so it was more like a mutual conversation, just to showcase what i was all about.
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself  in 10 years

title: Counseling Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions: After the application there was an interview with supervisors both in person and online to connect both the Brownsville and Edinburg campus. Consisted of questions about approach, ethics, and scenarios.
Interview Questions: What is your preferred counseling technique/approach?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions: Unnecessarily long, drawn out process with a lot of hoop jumping . With a few 1:1 interviews and then an interview  with about 5 people, you'll find this process taking up your time, and finally the offer is not worth your time. Since this is a university, so you can see everyones salary online so don't be undersold. Take note of the drastic gender pay gaps. See how the marketing dept is paid less on average than most university marketing depts. See the clear inequality.
Interview Questions: Why should we choose you to work here?

title: Senior Procurement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions: Great Interview process. They took a long time to call for the interview, but it was a pleasant interview, with no pressure great conversation between the candidate and evaluation committee
Interview Questions: They requested a Presentation to explain qualifications, past experience, and knowledge about Procurement processes.

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions: Due to Covid had a zoom interview with a panel of 3 and questions were asked between two people. Pretty straight forward and questions were asked on what was on resume and if you were able to do the duties in the job description.
Interview Questions: Why should we choose you?

title: Assistant Vice President Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Zoom for the first round.  Then I was invited to a Face to Face interview on campus that was an all day event.  I met with multiple groups and committees.  It was a great experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join UTRGV

title: Newspaper Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Brownsville, TX) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted after submitting my application. The interviewer was unfriendly and condescending throughout the entire interview. When I asked questions that pertained to the job, the interviewer was blatantly rude.  Overall my experience was terrible. I would not recommend.
Interview Questions: Do you not have a computer?

title: contact tracer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions: Interview was easy over the phone I was asked about basic knowledge of covid 19 and other procedures to help slow the spread of covid 19.  The interview process was smooth and had a pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: Knowledge about covid and it’s procedures.

title: Gear Up Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions: Not very personable. It wasn't clear to me what they were looking for, so it was tough to answer questions and provide background. Most questions did not have any follow up.
Interview Questions: Name a system you use for tracking

title: EPI Lead-Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: My interviewer met with me on time. This interview was online, I had an invite in my calendar set by the employee. We were able to share a screen. It was a systematic and friedly interview. I felt respect and confidence. I was able to clarify my questions and all the next steps were clear at the end.  I felt very grateful because this interview was very professional and well conducted.
Interview Questions: My interviewer was focused to know if I was able to do all essential functions for this job: managerial functions, screening, liaison and escalation, self-training and training for team members, and conduct the main goal of this job

title: Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: The resume process was very brief and it covered everything on my resume. I enjoyed answering the questions as everything on my resume truly reflected who I was and how hard I worked.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in my lab?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Questions: Traditional strengths and weaknesses. Managing stress. Dealing with conflict in an professional setting. Relevant experience to the job posting, unpaid and paid.

 Due to COVID, interview was based on Zoom. Business casual attire.
Interview Questions: Questions: Traditional strengths and weaknesses. Managing stress. Dealing with conflict in an professional setting. Relevant experience to the job posting, unpaid and paid.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: First you have to apply online at the university's website. Afterwards the secretary (depending on which department you applied) will call you to ask for an email so that she can send you a link to provide personal information and other personal stuff. After having send all requisites they will call you to schedule a individual meeting (zoom or in person).
Interview Questions: What is your dream job?

title: Intramural Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions: the process was okay, most of it was situational involving how to deal with different scenarios and issues at the rec center when in the supervisor role, what to do in situations
Interview Questions: How do you deal with bad co-workers

title: Accounting Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was respectful, and stayed on topic. They also make sure that you know your stuff on the position you are applying for. The interview was short, but very informative.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work Here?

title: Assitant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Required to present Teaching Demos for different subjects in Medical Microbiology such as, but not limited to, Introduction to Bacteriology, Virology, Parasitology, and respond various questions about teaching philosophy, and research background and interests.
Interview Questions: Relevant presentations on the medical field.

title: Research Data Collector Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Easy questions. Very friendly interviewers. Got a phone call then got an interview adter that they I had to get a tb testing and finerprints and submit documentation to human resources for background check
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions: I met with the professor I would work for at his office and he asked me about my current work. He wanted me to be able to focus on the research. While he would give me time for my studies, he did not want to compete with another area of employment. That was the make it or break it in receiving the job. He was willing to negotiate pay and I felt like it was fair.
Interview Questions: He asked me about my capability of being able to create communication with people I didn't know in professional settings as this was a big part of the job.

title: Human Resources Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, it was just an brief chat about my background and some technical skills done on the computer. It was also only one interview and I waited about a week to get notified that I was hired.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience with Excel?

title: Admissions Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview about experience in admissions and understanding of admissions processes and importance of enrollment and efficiency. The interview was thorough and informing; I became aware that the work that was being asked was not being offset by salary.
Interview Questions: they asked if i knew anything about admissions processes

title: Enrollment Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX)
Interview Descriptions: they called for an interview about a week after applying, interview went well. Called me 2 weeks after with offer letter.the process was pretty quick and it was mostly the paperwork and getting a hold of my references that took time.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Comfortable atmosphere with three member panel. Got there early, however the interview started a few minuets late. The director of the department probably has the best interviewer skills I have experienced.
Interview Questions: What student learning theories can you apply to the position?

title: AVID Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume and received a phone call from the director. Once I interviewed I was offered the job on the spot. The interview was very long and the director asked many questions. You will have to be able to think on your feet and answer scenario questions.
Interview Questions: How much and what type of experience do you have in the field of tutoring.

title: Advertising Sales Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Two people interviewed me, one of them connected from Brownsville via skype. Was different but they soon made me feel confortable. They offered me the job right after the meeting ended.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work with us?

title: Ticket Sales Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Asked me about my experiences with customer service and what roles I had during my time in college. I also talked about why I wanted to be a Ticket Sales Rep and what I  can bring to the table. They also taught me the day to day duties I would have.
Interview Questions: Do you have customer service experience?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: 3 questions of why you wanted to work for the university. Took a long time to get hired . Like about 3 months but it was worth it I learned a lot
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Accounting Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume through career connections and got called in for an interview. They reviewed it and asked me questions on my resume. The process was very simple, they outlined my hours there at the interview.
Interview Questions: When can you start?

title: Student Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Since I applied to work on the Philosophy Department website, the chair of the department interviewed me. It was a brief interview with the basic intent of reviewing my resume and my experience in web designing. Overall, the interview lasted for about ten minutes. After the interview, I was immediately given the job, based on my experience.
Interview Questions: Tell us a time when you struggled on something.

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: 1 interview in person that is scheduled with the faculty member directly, if hired, the secretary prepares the paperwork for HR, once the paperwork has been sent to HR, it takes 1-2 weeks for it to get processed therefore it takes you the same amount of time to be able to work.
Interview Questions: What is the grade obtained for the course I was applying for?

title: Supplemental Instructor Leader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview luckly. They just asked for resume and class schedule.  Very informal and efficient.  Hard to find available spots as its a good job. The people who work there usually stay long term while in school.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions: face to face in professor's office, they will ask you what you know about their research area or have you taken classes related to the area before, after that they will ask you some basic questions about their research area to see how much you know.
Interview Questions: what have you done in **are

title: Office Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions: Went smoothly with no issues.  Got the job the same day as the interview and remained there for a year and a half until I graduated.  Highly recommend for anyone to get a job here it possible.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Work Study Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions: great for students and anyone who is looking for a flexibale job. Note that although this is workstudy you still work hard and no excuses. For I had a lot of work and responisbilites.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 12 years

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: No interview. Just fill out the application. If they are going to hire you, you will get an email for an introductory meeting. That is about it. I need a couple more words to reach the thirty word minimum. I think this is it.
Interview Questions: There is no interview. Just fill out the application.

title: International Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was called the day right after application was submitted. Was interviewed by the director and assistant director simultaneously. After the interview it took around one month and a half to receive a decision from interviewers.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was on a need be basis, the head of the department asked me if I was interested in the position they had. They needed a research assistant with my abilities, so I accepted.
Interview Questions:
If I had the time to work on the project as well as take courses?
If I had the capabilities to work on the project?
If I was hired what would I do to go about getting started.

title: Office Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied through the Bronc Career Connection, and was invited to do an in-person interview. I was then called with a job-offer a day after. Since this was a student employment position, it was all quite quick.
Interview Questions: How can you help the department reach its goals?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Brownsville, TX) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Friendly and inquisitive. There were three people interviewing me, which seemed intimidating at first, but ended on laughs and a promise for a future job. The interviewers knew what they wanted and what they were looking for. They promised to call and set something up with me soon.
Interview Questions: How would you handle "this type of situation"?

title: Work Study Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
Interview Descriptions: I was already known in the department and they really needed a work study so I did not go through an interview process.
Interview Questions: Starting a job where it was a brand new field to me.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was brief just questions about my resume. Other questions such as if I knew how to use specific software. Also questions about if I knew anything about the transportation industry.
Interview Questions: Do you know how to use SolidWorks?

title: Departmental Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Depending upon how fast they need you, your interview can be one or two days after submitting your resume. Depending on how desperate they are you can be hired on the spot if you impress them. When I was interviewed I was hired the same day. Most people I knew were hired the same day.
Interview Questions: The specific experience that you have that is related to your job. For example if you applied to teach Biology expect to list every single thing in your life that you have done in an academic setting that pertains to Biology. The more the better.

title: Supplemental Instructor Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview was great, I was interviewed by the Supplemental Instruction Supervisor. He didn't ask a lot of questions, basic things. Good communication skills needed (will be in front of a group of students, to explain concepts from the class).
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: One interview, if they call you you have a 20% chance of being hired.  They also ask you for ridiculous amount of skills that they don't even understand.  I remember that I was required to have knowledge about GIS software and I never used it.  Some senior management are there based on politics and bureaucratic procedures.  If you are willing to get a low salary with a dead end position UTPA is your best shot.
Interview Questions: What is your experience within data management.

title: Office Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview was quick they looked at my resume asked me some questions about the things that I had listed on it. Then asked me a couple of questions in regards to the position and how I would be a good fit for the job I was applying.
Interview Questions: How flexible are you in regards to work hours.

title: Supplemental Instructor Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Submitted transcript,  letter of recommendation,  application to supplemental instruction coordinator. I was called later to meet with the coordinator for an interview,  a few weeks later i was made an offer and accepted.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Work Study Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (Edinburg, TX) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Pretty Easy. Answered a couple of questions about myself. Final question was which department I wanted to be in as they had two positions open in two different departments. I chose the systems department.
Interview Questions: What department do you want to be in?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Apply online and it took two month to get accepted. Normally you have to apply online first, and then contact with the graduate advisor to check whether they still have positions for the program. Normally they have enough funding since it's a normal public university.
Interview Questions: academic background and why you want to be a TA
